intro: Psychotria monocephala, commonly known as the "single-headed psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria monocephala is also known for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain insect species.
